description.narrative: United Nations Populations Fund (UNFPA) has gathered statistical evidence from gender-based violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Relative recently published data show no abatement in sexual violence cases. In North Kivu alone, 4689 cases were reported in 2011 and 7075 in 2012. Same tendency has been witnessed in South Kivu (2713 cases in 2011 and 5028 in 2012). According to UNFPA, DRC has the world?s highest number of reported gender-based violence cases. The role of woman in the Congolese soc iety is still very weak. Project Specific Objective: The role and participation of women in managing public affairs has improved in selected Provinces of North Kivu, South Kivu and Oriental ProvinceExpected Results:? Legal structures at Provincial level of North Kivu have improved to better address the issue of sexual violence? The awareness of community members in selected target communities on women?s and children?s rights has improved? Vulnerable women in selected communities participate actively in savi ng and credit groups and have their own income generating activities.? Local communities are part of and contribute to formal and non-formal peace support structures, on local, sub-national, national and international levelActivities: ? Supporting legal st ructures in North Kivu in data management of sexual violence cases? Training on the International Protocol on the Documentation and Investigation of Sexual Violence in Conflict? Awareness-raising in selected communities on women?s and children?s rights? Wo rking with men and boys as change agents to combat sexual violence? Supporting the existing Village Credit and Saving Associations of vulnerable women including survivors of sexual violence? Providing training on entrepreneurship and creating small-scale i ncome-generating activities?
